temper and responded with escalation. I was an awful family system.
But given we have years of accusations, it will be good for us both to see a real example we can break down, discuss how we could have done it better,
and improve ourselves so we can be better parents. Agree?

Dr Kwon confirmed Max’s afib episode was not a result of the medication he prescribed or Max stopping the medication. The medication has not, in
his experience, ever resulted in causing this condition. The fact that Max was not on the medication at the time was further evidence it did not result
in his episode. This is consistent with what the cardiologist communicated and what I shared with you previously.
Please share the medical opinion you have, that links stopping the medication with the afib episode Max experienced as you have alleged.

Let's just put this top bed, then, and move forward peacefully.  I am all in Christine! I don't even know what we have been fighting for now.
I am really happy we cleared this up.

Message 3965 of 4024
I never said it was because he stopped it. I said I did not know. This is just like when you said I called you a liar today but said, "I was unaware." This
stuff is all written down, Christine.
On the night of the ER visit, I complained that you unilaterally decided against Dr. Kwan's orders to discontinue his medication without telling him.
This bothered me because when we had just seen Dr. Kwan, you both noted Max was taking it on and off and had dropped 8 lbs. We all worked on a
plan. You adjusted his Vyvanse to 30 mg from 40mg, agreed he would take it daily, and had a small meal before bed.
I was expressing my concern about your disregard for Dr Kwan's orders. And it would be reasonable to ask the question at least if it could have been a
part of the reason we were there.  You have said it was not after taking to him. That is good news for everyone. But I would also ask that when we have
clear orders from a Doctor, we follow them or let them know that you plan to try something else. I hope that is reasonable.

From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 09/04/2024 at 11:44 PM)
Subject:Re: Max/Medicine/afib

You disagreed. Why are you changing your story and making something up? You disagreed.
I realize six or seven years ago, the person you chose to watch our kids started screwing our daughter's husband. But choosing Abby was poor
decision-making on your part. It shows why we both should be concerned about who is watching our kids. I did not choose Abby. You did.
As their parent, I have the right to know who the person is and what the contact information is.

The full history of my chats with Abby is attached.
She was a teenager who was legally an adult and actively having sex with our daughter's husband while you said she was looking after the kids. That is
what worries me about your judgment. You can make a case for bringing Abby into our lives, I just don't think it will be a good one. Your choice of
caregivers betrayed us deeply and was more focused on home wrecking than the well-being of Max and Adrian. I think you made my point for me if
you stand behind this one.
Sent:09/04/2024 at 06:13 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 09/04/2024 at 11:41 PM)
Subject:Re: Stalking and Harassment of Cargivers
Attachments:Abby.jpg (20 KB)
Message 3969 of 4024
We are wasting time and creating animosity. I hear you say something and then you deny it. I ask for a correction, so I know what you meant, but you
won't provide it. I have said all along in my emails and recaps, I am open to correction or clarification. I am not trying to mispresent you.
Can we sort this out? I don't want to fight over misunderstandings. Either you will let me see AD or not, share caregiver info or not, sign fidelity
papers or not, or require the DV box to be ticked or not. But this back-and-forth is pointless and has become counterproductive at this point.
Before we go to Jennifer, let's make a list of things we seem to disagree on and whether we actually believe them and can stand by them. Then, by
sharing them with her ahead of time, we can have a fruitful conversation.  But we don't finger-point because we know our position.
Sent:09/04/2024 at 06:42 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 09/04/2024 at 11:40 PM)
Subject:Peaceful Next Steps

We can start the list on a shared Word doc and structure it so that it is just our POV. If somebody said something we want to point to, attach it. It's
super simple. No hearsay, just a plain statement of facts and our point of view.  It's the most honest thing we can do together.
Of course, it binds us to our word, but it should. We should be honest and collectively stand by what we say to whoever asks. Not a different story to
every person, across any medium, on any given day. Let's share the doc, *track the changes*, and be accountable for our actions.
I have no issue standing by my statements. I assume you feel the same way. Can we try that?
Message 3970 of 4024
Let’s wrap this up.
You say Adrian did not want the meeting with me and that he did not say that he would feel safe at a Seahawks game alone with me if I blew on the
SoberLink before, during, and after.
We disagree. I think he wanted to have the meeting with me, we discussed it. I also know that he said what I reported in both meetings: We have
witnesses. How do we get to the bottom of this?
btw- if I used incorrect syntax, I am totally ok with your corrections. I believe the spirt of my statement is accurate though. But let’s ask Jennifer and
decide. That’s what she is here for, right?
That’s one thing off our list!

Message 3980 of 4024
So you said to communicate here and you have chosen your usual way to control me. You launch a series of insults and attacks, refuse to answer a
single question in the list that I have to we can work together, and immediately log off.
You know I will answear because you said I was bugging your phone in December. But I wasn’t I get alerts. And despite that, you do it every time to
control me and show me you can refuse to cooperate on anything constructively.
You did it last week when you went out of town without Fidelity solved costing me over 20k, refused to say who was watching Max, and violating our
signed residential agreement. I won’t see AD for 28 days between visits now at best.
You do this to torment me. You know that you have caused extreme anxiety and the loss I feel from you alienating our kids and disparaging me to all
our friends is overwhelming. You have systematically made it your mission to destroy me.
And again.... You log on, intimidate me, log off.
That’s the only thing you accomplished tonight.
Sent:09/05/2024 at 12:09 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 09/05/2024 at 07:54 AM)
Subject:Re: Stalking and Harassment of Cargivers
Message 3981 of 4024
I didn’t sleep again last night. I haven’t in a long time since you began terrorizing me again and really ramping up on the manipulation. And now with
fresh harassing threats it’s gotten worse. I stare at the ceiling g all night thinking about what you will possible try and do next to destroy me.
But tonight I could not get over what you have done to Adrian and I. I had printed out our texts since your campaign of hate began. It’s literally
hundreds of pages. Filled with jokes and asks to play together. We hung out every single day- hoops, pass plays, sneaker shopping, movies, swimming,
Sent:09/05/2024 at 05:51 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 09/05/2024 at 07:54 AM)
Subject:Adrian

street tacos...
We used to say “ego amo te” to each other every day. It’s Latin for “I love you.” It was our special thing. We don’t do that now. It’s days since we
talked. He was “mini me “ as you called him. We had a bond so strong in Dec that Dr Brown repeatedly called it out as a possible issue. We were “too
close” she said.
We went to Cabo on our own, multiple times. You like to say on one night he thought I was drunk. That’s what you say. But we got our wires crossed
during the national championship game and could not find each other for a few minutes. And he has never been right when he thought I was drunk
since this started.
You put him in the middle of every single situation and use him as a pawn to execute your personal vendetta, pissed off the “perfect mom” was
discovered having an affair with a married man that worked for her. But you will do anything in your power to keep that squeaky clean image fresh.
You and I both know the truth. We both acknowledge that when you and Lillian (who made me her mule to secretly smuggle spores into Canada)
decided this, I was the best Dad and Husband ever. We both remember the conversation in the kitchen where you said it and Max overhead, loudly
agreeing with you.
But you decided that instead of a kind divorce like we agreed to, and nesting as we said, you would destroy me. Take everything from me. Wife, kids,
home, money, friends, freedom, future in your crusade to make me the second biological father you stripped of his own children. Even using the same
playbook.
The funny thing about this all is that I always said we had a busted system. We needed help. But you have put the singular blame on me. Never seeing
a good day in 30 years together. That’s crazy btw. But since, your harassment and personal destruction has only proven the kind of person you are.
Always were.
And even though I was an amazing Dad and husband in 2023, you deny it. And even though all evidence points toward both my ongoing sobriety for
a year now, and many months of positive trip reports, you cling to a past to show I never changed so you can justify taking my kids. You simple ignore
reality.
But it’s all there. Tests, shots, Alan’s reports. Even if I was the only problem and you are blameless for events years ago, you can’t deny what I am now.
And have been. Yet you have still chosen to destroy the kids relationship with me. Taken their father away. And control my kids, my money, my
home, my future.
Let’s see what today holds.... more ’s for me instead of trying to work together and actually answering questions that help us move forward in a
constructive way. More “I wish you well, Robert’s” as you violate the residential plan and keep the kids caregiver information from me. It never
ends....
Message 3982 of 4024
OFW for parenting issues.
Given the contentious nature and my concern for in person and verbal confrontation, I don’t feel comfortable meeting with Jennifer in person at this
time. You are welcome to keep the meeting for yourself or cancel. I do not plan to attend.

We have a professional there. This is an intentional escalation and act of aggression in a series of them this week. You gave your word. My DV bill is
attached.
I have done everything you said. Everything. This is the one thing that can help us and what we agreed to wait till to solve all the outstanding issues.
If you are refusing to address issues we agreed to take to her we have no plan to solve them and that is only going to make things worse. How do we
solve those?
I am asking you let a professional rather than a lawyer drive this. This is the only safe way to resolve our issues and you made that commitment for the
kids.
You already delayed this a week. Please respond.

and continuing to exercise coercive control. It’s a documented pattern.
Please advise today. I had put things off because we had a promised plan. No that you have escalated again it will take days or weeks to have our

It was nice being there with you tonight. Together as their parents. SAAS is a safe zone. If we just designated anything to do with our kids as a "safe
zone" with the same "no shop talk" rules, we would be a much healthier family. We could literally open any door if we followed that simple rule.
Our "rock quantitative/qualitative" exercise also felt good. Someone else was leading the class, and you and I had instructions. If we extend the same
rule as above, we really could glass blow, cooking class, whatever. It's a baby step, but if we find humanity in each other again it's a game changer.
I actually think it is WAY SAFER than therapy or cofeve. Let's start by being human to each other.
